examples.description: is expected to validate that :name cannot be empty/falsy
examples.full_description: Author validations is expected to validate that :name cannot be empty/falsy

examples.description: is expected to validate that :email is case-sensitively unique
examples.full_description: Author validations is expected to validate that :email is case-sensitively unique

exception.message:
Expected Author to validate that :email is case-sensitively unique, but
this could not be proved.
  After taking the given Author, setting its :email to ‹"dummy value"›,
  and saving it as the existing record, then making a new Author and
  setting its :email to a different value, ‹"DUMMY VALUE"›, the matcher
  expected the new Author to be valid, but it was invalid instead,
  producing these validation errors:

  * name: ["can't be blank"]
  * email: ["has already been taken"]

examples.description: is expected to validate that :title cannot be empty/falsy
examples.full_description: Post validations is expected to validate that :title cannot be empty/falsy

examples.description: is expected to validate that :category is either ‹"Fiction"› or ‹"Non-Fiction"›
examples.full_description: Post validations is expected to validate that :category is either ‹"Fiction"› or ‹"Non-Fiction"›

exception.message:
Expected Post to validate that :category is either ‹"Fiction"› or
‹"Non-Fiction"›, but this could not be proved.
  After setting :category to ‹"shoulda-matchers test string"›, the
  matcher expected the Post to be invalid and to produce the validation
  error "is not included in the list" on :category. The record was
  indeed invalid, but it produced these validation errors instead:

  * title: ["can't be blank"]
  * category: ["must be either Fiction or Non-Fiction"]
  * content: ["is too short (minimum is 100 characters)"]

examples.description: is expected to validate that the length of :content is at least 100
examples.full_description: Post validations is expected to validate that the length of :content is at least 100
Authors POST /authors with valid author params creates a new author
Authors POST /authors with valid author params returns the author data
Authors POST /authors with valid author params returns a status code of 201 (created)

examples.description: does not create a new author

Authors POST /authors with invalid author params returns the error messages

exception.message: json atom at path "errors" is missing

exception.message: expected the response to have status code :unprocessable_entity (422) but it was :created (201)
